required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Acute Kidney Injury - Molecular Mechanisms of Dietary Pre-conditioning in Human
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Acute Kidney Injury - Molecular Mechanisms of Dietary Pre-conditioning in Human

brief_summary.textblock:
The key objective of this pilot study is to assess the molecular mechanisms of renal pre-conditioning by a one-week low-calorie diet in humans.
The protective effect of the low-calorie diet and also of the protein-restriction in donor on transplant qualities and functions in receptor will also be investigated.
Analysis of transcriptome, lipidome, metabolome, epigenome, proteome und phosphoproteome through tissue samples as well as blood samples for comparison of low-calorie diet, protein-restriction and no-diet groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of differentially regulated genes on a transcriptomic level
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year upon receipt of the last tissue sample
primary_outcome.description: Identification of relevant difference with regard to transcriptome in kidney tissue between patients with low-calorie diet and and no-diet patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of differentially regulated genes on a lipidome level
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 years upon receipt of the last tissue sample
primary_outcome.description: Identification of relevant difference with regard to lipidome in kidney tissue between patients with low-calorie diet and and no-diet patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of differentially regulated genes on a metabolome level
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 years upon receipt of the last tissue sample
primary_outcome.description: Identification of relevant difference with regard to metabolome in kidney tissue between patients with low-calorie diet and and no-diet patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of differentially regulated genes on a epigenome level
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 years upon receipt of the last tissue sample
primary_outcome.description: Identification of relevant difference with regard to epigenome in kidney tissue between patients with low-calorie diet and and no-diet patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of differentially regulated genes on a proteome level
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year upon receipt of the last tissue sample
primary_outcome.description: Identification of relevant difference with regard to proteome in kidney tissue between patients with low-calorie diet and and no-diet patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of differentially regulated genes on a phosphoproteome level
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 years upon receipt of the last tissue sample
primary_outcome.description: Identification of relevant difference with regard to phosphoproteome in kidney tissue between patients with low-calorie diet and and no-diet patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative from donor and receptor; 6h, 12h and 24h after renal transplantation from receptor.
secondary_outcome.description: Change of NGAL in urine, marker for kidney damage measured preoperative in donor and receptor.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative and up until 7 days after renal transplantation from receptor.
secondary_outcome.description: Marker for kidney damage measured preoperative and daily until Day 7 postoperative in receptor.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed up to approx. 30 days from date of renal transplantation until date of discharge, which is the end of observation.
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of acute kidney injury according to KDIGO I, II, III in receptor.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed up to approx. 30 days from date of renal transplantation until date of discharge, which is the end of observation.
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum postoperative serum creatinine of receptor during hospital stay.

arm_group.description: Donor taking low-calorie formula diet, 50% of basal energy rate, individually calculated with Mifflin-St. Jeor formula.

Donor taking protein-restricted diet according to diet plans of clinical dietetics of University Hospital of Cologne, with unchanged calorie supply, individually calculated with Mifflin-St. Jeor formula.
Donor taking same dishes as protein-restricted diet group but with customary protein levels, with unchanged calorie supply.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 years
- Competent patients
- Planned living kidney transplantation
- Provision of informed consent
- BMI ≥ 18,5 kg/m²
Exclusion Criteria:
